did.abstract: The collection contains approximately 350 pieces of correspondence and financial documents from the archive of the Central Committee Knesseth Israel Charity of Rabbi Meier Baal Haness in Jerusalem, an organization providing financial assistance to the poor. The archive includes letters from Jewish businesses on letterhead stationery, as well as from private individuals, with handwritten notes concerning their contributions, frequently accompanied by requests for information, prayers, or items from the Holy Land. The majority of the letters are from the United States, but others are from locations in Canada, England, and other countries.

langmaterial.language: The materials are primarily in Yiddish or English, with some in Hebrew.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains approximately 350 pieces of correspondence and financial documents from the archive of the Central Committee Knesseth Israel Charity of Rabbi Meier Baal Haness in Jerusalem, an organization providing financial assistance to the poor. The archive includes letters from Jewish businesses on letterhead stationery, as well as from private individuals, with handwritten notes concerning their contributions, frequently accompanied by requests for information, prayers, or items from the Holy Land. The majority of the letters are from the United States, but others are from locations in Canada, England, and other countries.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Central Committee Knesseth Israel was a charitable organization of the Ashkenazic Jewish community in Jerusalem founded in 1866 to provide financial support to needy individuals and religious institutions. According to Mark Wischnitzer's 1946 report prepared for the Council of Jewish Federations and Welfare Funds, its "activities included financial relief to needy members of the Kolelim [institutes for advanced Talmud study], free loans, support of various institutions, promotion of vocational training, distribution of matzoth and holiday gifts, and the supervision of holy places and religious observances."

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred from the Judaica Collection Curator, 2015. The materials were originally purchased from Bery Gross on the Rosalyn and Joseph Newman Collection Fund, 2011.
